channel.title: Help Wanted [KVM users]: Biometrics Fingerprinting Testing
channel.description:
Behavioral biometrics allow a site to identify a user by the way they type:
https://lists.nongnu.org/archive/html/qemu-discuss/2016-03/msg00023.html
Help us investigate how well the hypervisor protects against biometric fingerprinting by trying these demos under different setups and reporting back the results. We want to simulate the tests to be as close to real conditions as possible so run all these demos in Iceweasel in all environments because Tor Browser has some defenses but they won't help if an attacker has taken over the workstation vm.
Type normally as you would to not affect results. Two separate machines are preferred for some extra tests but not necessary.
Keyboard demos: https://www.behaviosec.com/demos/ https://www.keytrac.net/
Mouse demos: http://jcarlosnorte.com/assets/ubercookie/
* Test 1: run all demos in Whonix workstation vs host * Test 2: remove the virtual tablet device from the workstation virt-manager settings then run the mouse demo only in workstation vs host. * Test 3: all demos in Whonix workstation vs vanilla Debian Jessie guest * Test 4: all demos on host machine 1 vs host machine 2

item.title: Help Wanted [KVM users]: Biometrics Fingerprinting Testing
item.dc:creator: Patrick
item.description:
This is a good test:

keytrac.net

Live test our biometrics solution

Give KeyTrac a try and test our solution live, for free and without a clumsy registration.

  • no need to register
  • the user name / password entry is just to record / detect your typing pattern

Read full topic
item.source: Help Wanted [KVM users]: Biometrics Fingerprinting Testing

item.title: Help Wanted [KVM users]: Biometrics Fingerprinting Testing
item.dc:creator: HulaHoop
item.description:
Not that I know of. Most of this technology is proprietary and marketed to banks and advertising companies. At least those demos are publicly available.

Read full topic

item.title: Help Wanted [KVM users]: Biometrics Fingerprinting Testing
item.dc:creator: HulaHoop
item.description:
Behavioral biometrics allow a site to identify a user by the way they type:

https://lists.nongnu.org/archive/html/qemu-discuss/2016-03/msg00023.html

Help us investigate how well the hypervisor protects against biometric fingerprinting by trying these demos under different setups and reporting back the results. We want to simulate the tests to be as close to real conditions as possible so run all these demos in Iceweasel in all environments because Tor Browser has some defenses but they wonâ€™t help if an attacker has taken over the workstation vm.

Type normally as you would to not affect results. Two separate machines are preferred for some extra tests but not necessary.

Keyboard demos:

Behaviosec

Live Demo - BehavioSec

Try it out yourself. See how behavioral biometrics can prevent fraud and improve UX.


keytrac.net

Keyboard biometrics

Identify people based on keystroke dynamics. KeyTrac works with any existing keyboard and doesn't require any special hardware.

Mouse demos:
http://jcarlosnorte.com/assets/ubercookie/

  • Test 1: run all demos in Whonix workstation vs host
  • Test 2: remove the virtual tablet device from the workstation virt-manager settings then run the mouse demo only in workstation vs host.
  • Test 3: all demos in Whonix workstation vs vanilla Debian Jessie guest
  • Test 4: all demos on host machine 1 vs host machine 2

Read full topic
item.source: Help Wanted [KVM users]: Biometrics Fingerprinting Testing
